result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander C Rogers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to be paid in full no later than 12-31-2015. Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done.

*Defense motions the Court to consider expungement. For the reasons placed on the record the Court denies the Defense motion for expungement.*
Consecutive to: to any sentence; credit for 60 days (1-17-2015 TO 3-17-2015), TIME SERVED.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexander C Rogers

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alexander C Rogers in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Defendant Alexander C Rogers in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case proceeds to Plea and Sentencing. 
AS TO COUNT 1 - 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
Court ordered defendant to serve 60 DAYS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; credit for 60 days (1-17-2015 TO 3-17-2015), TIME SERVED.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to be paid in full no later than 12-31-2015. Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

Defense motions the Court to consider expungement. For the reasons placed on the record the Court denies the Defense motion for expungement. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Attorney Mark E. Kershek in court, defendant Alexander C Rogers not in court, in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Held off the record. Case set for plea hearing. Court is in jury trial on another matter. Case adjourned for projected plea and sentencing hearing in Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mark E. Kershek in court, defendant Alexander C Rogers not in court, in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant not produced. Defense counsel waives defendants appearance. At the request of the Defense the case is adjourned for Projected Plea Hearing on 4-15-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17. Any Defense motion is due no later than 4-15-2015 at 8:30 a.m.  Calendar call scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Case scheduled for Scheduling Conference on 2-16-2015 at 1:30 p.m., Br. 17 is down. Case is rescheduled for Scheduling Conference on 2-26-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17. 
Parties notified via telephone.

Defendant Alexander C Rogers not in court, defendant in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel is not available for today's proceedings.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17, Judge Stark.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Alexander C Rogers in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Defendant Alexander C Rogers in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Status conference scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
